titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I completed the sermons for tomorrow. After lunch Prebendary Hopton came to see me about some diocesan matters â€“ a large, rather pompous man now retired from parochial work. I attended Evensong in the Cathedral, but did not wear my robes, preferring to sit in the back of the nave to hear the "Handel" music more advantageously. I made desperate efforts to clear up my table, & arrange my rapidly–accumulating letters on some intelligible principle, but with very little success.
